category.label: All Killer No Filler
category.plot: All Killer No Filler gamelist people who are interested in quality over quantity.[CR]Yes its subjective, but I trust the judgement of people with a passion for a genre.[CR]This is not about listing every game. That would put us right back up to scrolling through thousands of games, most of which suck.[CR]Arcade games only, plain old joystick controls only.

category.label: Griffin518s Best of Arcade
category.plot: Griffin518s list was developed for a 2-player cabinet with standard orientation, 8-way joysticks and six buttons per player. There is no trackball or spinner on the control panel. So that being said, following are the requirements kept in mind:[CR]Top 350-ish working arcade games (totally subjective, of course)[CR]Based on official MAME database[CR]Im in the US and think the US loading screens are cool, so Ive included most US clones instead of parents (exception being where parent version is much preferred)[CR]2-player clones of 3+ player games are included instead of parents (ex: TMNT and X-Men)[CR]No driving, spinner, dial, trackball, analog, or really custom control games (apologies to many great games).

category.label: Arcade Manager Classics Lite Analog
category.plot: About 50 classic games that can be played with a modern analog gamepad (Playstation, Xbox)

category.label: Arcade Manager Classics Lite No Analog
category.plot: About 50 classic games that can be played with an old gamepad or arcade stick

category.label: Arcade Manager Classics Analog
category.plot: About 200 to 300 games that can be played with a modern analog gamepad (Playstation, Xbox)

category.label: Arcade Manager Classics No Analog
category.plot: About 200 to 300 games that can be played with an old gamepad or arcade stick

category.label: Arcade Manager Lite Analog
category.plot: All working games, excluding clones and console games, that can be played with a modern analog gamepad (Playstation, Xbox)

category.label: Arcade Manager Lite No Analog
category.plot: All working games, excluding clones and console games, that can be played with an old gamepad or arcade stick

category.label: Arcade Manager Neo Geo
category.plot: All Neo Geo games

category.label: Arcade Manager Alternative Controls
category.plot: All games having alternative controllers: lightgun, 2 or 3 joysticks, etc.

category.label: Arcade Manager Analog Controls
category.plot: All games having analog controllers: wheel, dial, trackball, etc.

category.label: Arcade Manager Pad Controls
category.plot: All games that can be controlled with a modern analog pad

category.label: Arcade Manager Stick Controls
category.plot: All games that can be controlled with an arcade stick

category.label: Arcade Manager Consoles Only
category.plot: All console and console-derived games: NeoGeo, Playchoice 10, Nintendo vs, etc.

category.label: Arcade Manager Good Clones Only
category.plot: Clones that work while the parent does not

category.label: Arcade Manager Slow Only
category.plot: All games too modern to run on a Raspberry Pi (basically all 3D games)

category.plot: All games marked as quality 0-10 by AntoPISA

category.plot: All games marked as quality 10-20 by AntoPISA

category.plot: All games marked as quality 20-30 by AntoPISA

category.plot: All games marked as quality 30-40 by AntoPISA

category.plot: All games marked as quality 40-50 by AntoPISA

category.plot: All games marked as quality 60-70 by AntoPISA

category.plot: All games marked as quality 70-80 by AntoPISA

category.plot: All games marked as quality 90-100 by AntoPISA

category.label: Parent
category.plot: Arcade games identified as the parent. In a given game set, usually (but not necessarily) the most recent bugfixed World revision of a game, will be designated as the parent.

category.label: Clone
category.plot: Arcade games identified as the clone. In a given game set, usually (but not necessarily) the most recent bugfixed World revision of a game, will be designated as the parent. All sets that use mostly the same chips (e.g. Japanese Puckman and USA/World Pac-Man) will be clones that contain only the changed data compared to the parent set.

category.label: Unknown
category.plot: These games have an unknown custom grouping or no custom grouping was identified
